meaningMnemonic: The <kanji>flower</kanji> <kanji>fire</kanji>... what looks like flowers on fire? That would be <vocabulary>fireworks</vocabulary>. Totally makes sense, right?
readingMnemonic: The readings for the kanji that make this word are the kun'yomi readings, where fire's ひ changes to び. You already learned the kun'yomi reading for 花 when you learned the kanji, so it's only a matter of remembering to use the kun'yomi for 火. If you do, you should be able to read this word.
